com.turn.ttorrent.client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.turn.ttorrent.client.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AnnounceResponseListener, IncomingConnectionListener, PeerActivityListener, Runnable, EventListener

    public class Client
extends Observable
implements Runnable, AnnounceResponseListener, IncomingConnectionListener, PeerActivityListener
    A pure-java BitTorrent client.

    A BitTorrent client in its bare essence shares a given torrent. If the torrent is not complete locally, it will continue to download it. If or after the torrent is complete, the client may eventually continue to seed it for other clients.

    This BitTorrent client implementation is made to be simple to embed and simple to use. First, initialize a ShareTorrent object from a torrent meta-info source (either a file or a byte array, see com.turn.ttorrent.SharedTorrent for how to create a SharedTorrent object). Then, instantiate your Client object with this SharedTorrent and call one of download() to simply download the torrent, or share() to download and continue seeding for the given amount of time after the download completes.

    Author:
    mpetazzoni

      • stop

        public void stop(boolean wait)
        Immediately but gracefully stop this client.
        Parameters:
        wait - Whether to wait for the client execution thread to complete or not. This allows for the client's state to be settled down in one of the DONE or ERROR states when this method returns.

      • run

        public void run()
        Main client loop.

        The main client download loop is very simple: it starts the announce request thread, the incoming connection handler service, and loops unchoking peers every UNCHOKING_FREQUENCY seconds until told to stop. Every OPTIMISTIC_UNCHOKE_ITERATIONS, an optimistic unchoke will be attempted to try out other peers.

        Once done, it stops the announce and connection services, and returns.

        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • info

        public void info()
        Display information about the BitTorrent client state.

        This emits an information line in the log about this client's state. It includes the number of choked peers, number of connected peers, number of known peers, information about the torrent availability and completion and current transmission rates.

        Handle an announce response event.

      • handleNewPeerConnection

        public void handleNewPeerConnection(SocketChannel channel,
                                    byte[] peerId)
        Handle a new peer connection.

        This handler is called once the connection has been successfully established and the handshake exchange made. This generally simply means binding the peer to the socket, which will put in place the communication thread and logic with this peer.

        Specified by:
        handleNewPeerConnection in interface IncomingConnectionListener
        Parameters:
        channel - The connected socket channel to the remote peer. Note that if the peer somehow rejected our handshake reply, this socket might very soon get closed, but this is handled down the road.
        peerId - The byte-encoded peerId extracted from the peer's handshake, after validation.
        See Also:
        SharingPeer

      • handleFailedConnection

        public void handleFailedConnection(SharingPeer peer,
                                   Throwable cause)
        Handle a failed peer connection.

        If an outbound connection failed (could not connect, invalid handshake, etc.), remove the peer from our known peers.

        Specified by:
        handleFailedConnection in interface IncomingConnectionListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer we were trying to connect with.
        cause - The exception encountered when connecting with the peer.

      • handlePeerReady

        public void handlePeerReady(SharingPeer peer)
        Description copied from interface: PeerActivityListener
        Peer ready handler.

        This handler is fired when a peer notified that it is no longer choked. This means we can send piece block requests to it and start downloading.

        Specified by:
        handlePeerReady in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer that became ready.

      • handlePieceCompleted

        public void handlePieceCompleted(SharingPeer peer,
                                 Piece piece)
                          throws IOException
        Piece download completion handler.

        When a piece is completed, and valid, we announce to all connected peers that we now have this piece.

        We use this handler to identify when all of the pieces have been downloaded. When that's the case, we can start the seeding period, if any.

        Specified by:
        handlePieceCompleted in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer we got the piece from.
        piece - The piece in question.
        Throws:
        IOException
